comments:
Build ID: WTP 2.0

Steps To Reproduce:
I was testing our product based on WTP 2.0 and ran into an
ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException just after creating a project. It appeared to be related to server publishing but my changes should not have affected the server. Here's the stack:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.wst.server.core 4 0 2007-11-09 12:40:27.796
!MESSAGE Error calling delegate ModuleArtifactAdapter[org.eclipse.jst.web.server.webresource4]
!STACK 0
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: Array index out of range: 0
	at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.web.deployables.WebDeployableArtifactUtil.getModuleObject(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.jst.servlet.ui.internal.deployables.WebDeployableArtifactAdapterFactory.getModuleArtifact(Unknown Source)

	at org.eclipse.wst.server.ui.internal.ServerPropertyTester.checkProperty(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.ui.internal.ServerPropertyTester.test(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.expressions.Property.test(Unknown Source)

	at org.eclipse.core.internal.expressions.CompositeExpression.evaluateAnd(Unknown Source)

	at org.eclipse.core.internal.expressions.CompositeExpression.evaluateAnd(Unknown Source)

	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.contextlaunching.LaunchingResourceManager.getResourceLabel(Unknown Source)

More information:

This could be either server tools or J2EE. I'm not sure. Please reroute if necessary.
Looks like debug UI just updating labels, ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException is in jst.j2ee.
